R6.String: As a nurse, I have my patient assessments finished at around 9:30 a.m., &val& me some time to formally document them in the computer before 10 a.m. when medications are due.

R7.String: As a writer, I like to work in short concentrated &val&, with plenty of procrastination in between.

R8.String: On an average day, a registered nurse might administer medication, consult &val& other healthcare providers, monitor patients, educate individuals and families, and be responsible for managing medical records.

R9.String: Since I am a neurologist, I have to sometimes rush to the hospital &val& emergency cases and take care of the patients.

R1.Passage: As the world changes rapidly, education needs to evolve to ensure that younger generations have the necessary skills to be of value in the society. While education needs to evolve, it also needs to become more accessible to the hundreds of millions of young people who are restricted from education by poverty, diversity politics, gender, disability, armed conflict, and displacement.
R1.A: Education needs to be adaptive and accessible
R1.C: Change is inevitable and we need to adapt
R1.D: Education inequality is a huge problem

R2.Passage: For purely interactive purposes, one language may be all the world needs. There is no end to the things that can be expressed in English-or in any other language. But language is an expression of culture and perhaps the bilingual, multicultural, integrated society is where we are heading. Then we can tell each other about our own special cultures and language.
R2.B: A diverse solution to the language problem
R2.Answer: A diverse solution to the language problem

R3.Passage: For many centuries the world has been losing languages, but they do seem to be disappearing at an incredible rate more recently. Roughly 6000 languages are spoken in the world today, yet it is staggering to hear linguists predict that half of them will vanish in this century, and 90 per cent will be gone by the next.

R4.Passage: Consumers concerned about the hazards of noise can reduce noise pollution in many ways. They can purchase noisy products such as garbage disposals and lawnmowers with reduced noise levels. They can also use sound-absorbing materials in their home. Carpeting can be installed instead of hard flooring, and cork and fabric can be used in rooms that tend to be noisy. Also, people can become less noisy.

R5.Passage: Every language has subtle distinctions and allusions of its own which cannot be fully expressed in another language. It's not just about literal translation or grammar. A language reflects its culture, from the vocabulary it contains to its style and literary traditions. Not everything can be translated into English or any of the other major languages: it might retain its meaning but it will surely lose its spirit.
R5.Answer: Language is more than just simply communication
R5.D: Language is more than just simply communication

R6.Passage: Summer is a wonderful time to spend at West Beach. It is a beach with soft, light-colored sand. The coastline goes on for a long way and many people enjoy walking along with it. Children like to play in the surf and walk along the rocks that are visible at low tide. This is a fun beach for people of all ages.
R6.A: Summer is a wonderful time at West Beach
R6.C: Walking is nice at West Beach
R6.D: Going to the beach in summer
R6.B: West Beach is a wonderful beach
R6.Answer: West Beach is a wonderful beach

R7.Passage: Most teenagers and young adults do not know what they want to do for the rest of their lives. It is a big decision. There are a number of things you can do to narrow the choices. For example, you can take an interests test, do some research on your own about a career, try volunteer work in the field in which you are interested, or "job-shadow", in which you spend a day with a person who is working in a field that interests you. These are just a few helpful ideas as you begin to choose a career.
R7.B: Finding a job is hard for young people
R7.Answer: A few ideas to help the reader choose a career
R7.D: A few ideas to help the reader choose a career
R7.A: Teenagers are not able to find jobs

R8.Passage: Children dream of the day when they will be grown up. They believe that being an experienced adult will truly give them freedom. Then they grow up. They are saddled by bills, responsibilities, sleepiness, and an overwhelming urge for more vacations. Now they long for the days they could roam free all summer without a care in the world.
R8.A: Innocence has always battled with experience
R8.Answer: Innocence has always battled with experience
